article.Heading: Bill to regularise illegal houses in budget session: Goa CM
article.Summary: According to the Chief Minister, structures built on one's own property or on others' property with proper ownership no-objection certificate (NOC) would be considered.
article.Body:
The Goa government today said it would table a Bill to regularise unauthorised structures in the upcoming Budget session of the state Assembly.

"The draft of the Bill is ready. We will table the Bill on regularisation of illegal or unauthorised structures and encroachments during the forthcoming Assembly session," Chief Minister Laxmikant Parsekar told reporters today after chairing the state Cabinet meeting.

The week-long Budget session is scheduled to begin from March 14.

Parsekar said the Bill will regularise the structures, which were constructed before February 28, 2014. "These structures will need to have their land titles clear," he added.

According to the Chief Minister, structures built on one's own property or on others' property with proper ownership no-objection certificate (NOC) would be considered.

However, he said the structures in Coastal Regulation Zones (CRZ) and along the roadside would not be regularised.
